zone.line: [reverso]
contemporary. The pretence of doing it
would be a presumption in all any but
pride
the greatest, the effect even in him
could he accomplish such would be strained ,
unnatural & ineffectual. A Poet, is the
combined product of such internal powers
as modify the nature of others, & of such
external influences as modify the excite
& sustain these powers; he is not one
of , but both. Every man's mind is
in this respect modified by all the
objects of nature & art, by every word
& every suggestion which he ever admitted
to act upon his consciousness; it is
the mirror upon which all forms
are reflected, & in which they
compose one form. Men, are Poets,
not otherwise than philosophers or artis
sculptors
painters or musicians, are in one
creeps
sense the creators & in another the
creations of their age. From this
ain
subjection the loftiest do not escape.
There is a similarity, among suffic
